oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 49 a
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 49 a. Newspaper clipping: (fragment) 'Senator Poindexter of Washington state...'
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Voting;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Senator Poindexter of Washington state, recently introduced in the senate an amendment to the fourteenth amendment of the federal constitution which, if passed, will have the effect of reducing the representation in the state in the in the(sic.) proportion which the number of disenfranchised persons shall bear to the whole number of citizens of voting age. This ought to make the eastern and soouthern states "sit up and take notice."
